definition: abbr. for Egypt 埃及[Ai1 ji2]
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized

sentences.english: The rotten heart to water, dust to be a disappearing eyes.
sentences.chinese: 把发霉的心事交给流水，向远去的尘埃行个注目礼。

sentences.english: Elephant trunk-like dust pillars point towards the hot blue stars and are tell-tale signs of their eroding effect.
sentences.chinese: 指向蓝色热星的象鼻状尘埃柱是辐射侵蚀效果的证据。

sentences.english: She will just fall like a grain of dust into oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 她将只是那一粒被遗忘的尘埃。

sentences.english: How does Microbeam Techniques Apply to the Studies of Aerosol Particles?
sentences.chinese: 如何将微束分析技术应用到大气尘埃颗粒研究之中？

sentences.english: But the world has become a repeated dust, the dust has settled that moment, Jesus Christ reincarnation.
sentences.chinese: 不过成为世间一屡尘埃，尘埃落定那刻，万世轮回。

sentences.english: But the world has become a repeated dust, the dust has settled that moment, Jesus Christ reincarnation.
sentences.chinese: 不过成为世间一屡尘埃，尘埃落定那刻，万世轮回。

sentences.english: More than 250 metric tons of lunar dust will be lofted above the surface of the Moon.
sentences.chinese: 超过250万吨月球尘埃将放样以上的月球表面。

sentences.english: The ring itself is tenuous, made up of a thin array of ice and dust particles.
sentences.chinese: 环本身是脆弱的，由稀薄的冰和尘埃粒子阵组成。

sentences.english: The effects of bleaching on dirt count of bleached whole cotton stalk chemical pulp were studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 对漂白对全棉秆漂白化学浆尘埃度的影响进行了研究。

sentences.english: If the stellar spectrum is known, the albedo of the dust can be obtained.
sentences.chinese: 如果恒星的光谱已知，就可得出尘埃的反照率。

sentences.english: Barnard's markings are dark nebulae, interstellar clouds of obscuring gas and dust.
sentences.chinese: 巴纳德的标记黑暗星云，星际云掩盖气体和尘埃。

sentences.english: Of this material, about a percent or less was in the form of dust.
sentences.chinese: 这种物质的百分之一或更少是以尘埃的形式存在的。

sentences.english: Orb 2 accurately mimics the type of orbs reproduced by dust particles.
sentences.chinese: 2号光点与拍摄尘埃微粒复制出的那类光点十分相像。

sentences.english: Who keep long vigils by the silent dust, and weep.
sentences.chinese: 在落下的尘埃前久久守候，哭泣。

sentences.english: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.
sentences.chinese: 他当口贴尘埃，或者有指望。

sentences.english: When the sun goes down, the rocks stay warm. But the dust of the moon cannot store heat.
sentences.chinese: 当太阳下山时，岩石依旧温暖，但月球上的尘埃存热。

definition: to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
mundane world (in religious context)/this mortal coil
